poem:
"A Morning at Hamilton Hall"

Occupation at dawn,
Crimson Palestine calls.
Doors cloaked in resistance,
A message hangs from the walls.
Voices in stereo echo, 
Radios hum in the fall.
The university breathes,
In the quiet of Hamilton Hall.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "First Thing: Pro-Palestine protesters take over Columbia University building Good morning. Dozens of protesters have occupied a building at Columbia University in New York, barricading the doors and hanging a Palestine flag from a window as demonstrations against the Israel-Hamas war step up on US campuses. Columbia’s student radio station broadcast a report of the takeover of Hamilton Hall early on Tuesday, while posts on a related Instagram account encouraged others to protect the encampment". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
